Reviews.Title: A Great Portable Camera
Reviews.Author: Ruth Adamson
Reviews.Content: I really like this Sony.  I bought it because I needed a portable camera.  I use a Canon S10 IS but it is too big to carry around on vacation or casual events.  I was wary because the reviews on Amazon were varied but a digital camera review site gave it extremely high marks.  After having this camera for 3 weeks, here are the pros and cons:PROS:The best auto - mode I have seen anywhere. I took pics in Disney world in daytime and low light conditions, indoor and out, and the pictures came out great with no flash needed...ISO adjusted automaticallyBurst mode - press and hold button to take 3 consecutive shots10x zoom - almost unheard of for a camera this smallShutter speed is great, yes really.  But if you are in auto mode and the setting has changed (daytime to twilight for example) your first shot will be delayed while it changes to the new modePortrait mode will recognize up to 8 faces in your picture, great for families or group shotsSony now has a slot for an SD card in addition to their Memory Stick, this was a big selling point for meCONS:Shutter speed for changing modes as above.  You can manually set the mode to bypass that.I have not yet figured out how to stop the preview after a pic. Not sure that is Sony's fault.No optical viewfinder.  They are more rare in small cameras but help when it's sunny out.This camera takes some practice.  Not a lot, but you really do need to look at the online manual to get the best use from it.MY CONCLUSION:Overall I am very happy with my purchase.  If you want a point and shoot that is easy out of the box, there are better suited cameras out there.  If you want a camera that's a few steps up from a basic point and shoot, this one is great if you are willing to take the time to learn how to use it.  Once you do, changing the settings is fast and easy.

Reviews.Title: Typical Sony camera...GREAT!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd Sony camera and like the others it takes great pictures. What I mainly like about the camera is the SteadyShot stabilization and the Active mode that is available for videos. Other cameras usually only have an electronic stabilization which doesn't really do anything. Sony's actually physically moves the sensor. Getting up in years, my hands are not as steady as they used to be and at full zoom, taking a picture or video with other cameras at full zoom is very jumpy. Another cool feature is the Sweep Panorama which creates some great shots. Unfortunately the only way I have found to view them in sweep mode is using the included PMB software. Viewing them in a slideshow only gives a static image though. All-in-all, you can't go wrong with this camera.PRO's - Steadyshot, great pictures. zoom rangeCON's - Zoom noise is very prevalent in videos

Reviews.Title: Sony 16mp camera
Reviews.Author: Roy Allen "rlaj"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera five days ago. Paid full retail which was around $229.00 and I had to buy a memory card, it did not come with one. The picture quality is great and it is very simple to use. The panorama actually works pretty good and I got it to take a panoramic photo on the 3rd try. The movie quality is outstanding, and again, easy to use. There are some settings I've yet to figure out. To me, it seems like a lot of camera fo the money. Plus, I've not had many problems with Sony products.

Reviews.Title: Almost Perfect.....
Reviews.Author: TGV
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera this past weekend, used it at my sons baseball game the pictures came out nice, just wish the zoom was a little bit longer, for having 10x zoom the camera is small and slim, it might not have touch screen and all the other little nice features but it does what a camera should do take nice pictures.  I use to use a olypmus 10x zoom and a kodak 10x zoom but this little camera in my opinion takes nicer looking photos and is a lot smaller then those other bulker cameras i use to use, I think this camera is a bang for the buck.

Reviews.Title: Oh so disappointing experience
Reviews.Author: Veese
Reviews.Content: Really wanted this camera to be as brilliant as it's described but after using it for nearly a month it just wasn't the case. Really fell in love with the panoramic shot feature which originally clinched the purchase beyond all the other high tech aspects of this camera. But the results were mixed and in the end I returned the purchase to Amazon (Thank you Amazon for an excellent return policy!).I could not compensate for two big photo issues:1) I kept getting a bit of a "fish-eye" lens effect especially when I was closer to objects. But even when taking a group photo standing 10 or more feet away, the edges of the image slightly curved off to the background while the center was pulled forward. I couldn't understand why this was happening and it became annoying.2) Camera had a hard time handling bright light or objects with bright colors outside. Other reviews here mention a type of "photoshopping" effect they noticed in their photos or odd diffusion. I now know what they meant. Again, no matter how I messed with the settings, and I messed with them A LOT, the outdoor images in sunlight were somewhat hazy. Say a subject in an outdoor shot wore a bright color shirt...that shirt would generate a "hot spot" in that area of the photo or a hazy glow. I may be describing it poorly but the bottom line is that outdoor photos were not crisp, sharp or all that colorful. If anything I think the colors were dulled or washed out in end results. In some shots it's almost as if I had vasoline on my lens...diffusing everything in the shot, a la how the "The VIEW" is shot.I've seen people comment here that well, maybe the white balance needed some adjustment. Ok, I did mess with that but at the same time this model camera should be able to be used straight up as a point-n-shoot. With today's technology, it's not too much to ask for a 16M digital camera to just give me very good images outdoors without having to mess with settings for every kind of circumstance.Just to say something positive, I was very impressed with the zoom feature of this model. I could stand on the opposite side of a yard, zoom in on a subject, then take that digital image and crop it in even closer and the details were still held fast in the end result.Also, I tried out the HD video once or twice and was pleased with the results of both image and sound. Now I just need to start all over again and find a camera that can put it all together.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Josie "momofone"
Reviews.Content: I tried several $150.00 cameras.  That was my "limit."  This one is so much better!  I read a professional review that said this camera was really not good enough for action shots involving animals and kids.  So untrue!  All of the other cameras I have experienced had what I think is called a long shutter lag.  You would hit the button and the picture wouldn't snap for another second - you always lost the good shot.  It seems to me that this one shoots very quickly.  The review said the time between pictures was over 4 seconds.  It was fast enough for me, and didn't seem to be 4 seconds at all.  I love this camera and am very happy to have spent the extra $40 over what I wanted to spend.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber-Shot DSC-H70
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: Purchased 14 July 2011 (to replace a Canon SX30IS that I sold after a few months of very unsatisfied use).Though I am definitely only a hobbyist, I am very experienced with photography, film and digital. Now-a-days, most of my photos are taken while hiking/Geocaching.I like the "In Camera" guide, it goes wherever the camera goes. Now, when out on a hike and I want to learn about a function... I can!!!  Along those lines, the "In Camera" guide is better than the printed "Instruction Manual"  but not as good as the online "User Guide".When there are more than just a few photos on the card, it takes a fair amount longer than I've previously experienced with other units to arrange them and then eventually display them for viewing.Close-up is focus is slower than I would like. It is common for me to see a bug/insect along a trail where I try to move the camera as close as possible before the critter flies/jumps away. Compared to similar shots I have taken with other cameras my percentage of "keepers" is at the low end.The mode selection dial turns MUCH, MUCH too easily. I've accidentally turned the dial numerous times, even while in the process of taking a shot.A minor irritant, for some odd reason, when attached to a computer via USB for downloading photos, the lens pops out, then back in when first turned on.I have more than enough software already on my computer and I did not load the supplied software, choosing to manage my photos by less proprietary means, as I have with my previous digital cameras. The H70, unlike other units, when opened with MS Windows Explorer, sees it as 3 independent drives. What a pain-in-the-axx.Four times (so far) the battery door popped open when pulling the camera out of my pocket or case.The LCD screen has developed a "spot" appearing as a blurry dark area, about 1/4" x 1/8" in size. It does not affect the digital image but it is an undesirable flaw.A function I really miss is an option to select ON for the flash. The only options available are AUTO or OFF. I've found the AUTO function to be rather inconsistent, for example, on occasions the subject is shadow but the flash does not fire. On other occasions (rather often really) I've been taking photos of scenery, with the nearest foreground object hundreds of feet away and yet the flash fires. I really don't mind so much the flash firing when it does not need to but it's really irritating to NEED flash and yet it just won't fire.Not unique to this camera but it would be nice if there was an option to enter "If found please contact:" owner data. i.e. that on start up, the owners Name, phone number/e-mail address, etc. could be displayed.Not my favorite digital camera but I've found it to be an acceptable unit that is easy to use and takes pretty good pictures most of the time. Though my comments may seem overall negative, I really do think the camera is worth the price.Previously owned digital cameras:Olympus xxx (don't recall the model but it was a great camera)Sony Cyber-shot 5.1 mp, 3X zoom - loved itCanon PowerShot S3IS 6.0 mp, 12X zoom - loved it moreNikon L22 Coolpix (wife's camera) - good (but battery door broke)Canon SX30IS, 14.1 mp, 35X zoom - got rid of it after a couple of months use

Reviews.Title: Amazing Quality
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: Worth the money!There are only two minor problems that I found, easily fixable:1) There is a tiny bit of stretching at the corners of pictures. As an example I took a picture of my girlfriend standing in front of the Eiffel tower. She wanted the entire tower in the picture, so I basically had to take the picture looking straight up (we were at the base). When I tilted the camera so that just her upper body was in the picture, her face stretched. This is due to the fact that the camera has a wide angle lens.If you want to take pictures and focus on a person's face, it works great! But if there face is the size of a pinky nail and is located in one of the corners of the lcd screen (and therefore the lens) expect stretching. I'm sure most people won't find this to be a problem anyway. To fix my picture I just had my girlfriend get closer to the camera, fixed everything.2) Night shots aren't the best, but for a point-and-shoot, there pretty damn good. The first ones weren't always clear, so just press the delete button and try again.Overall, this camera is a steal. The smart camera function works really well and it is a 16 mega pixel camera... for $200! I got it. I love it. Don't second guess yourself! Get this camera!

Reviews.Title: Not all that I'd hoped, but okay
Reviews.Author: Granover
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because my previous Sony had 7.2 pixels and 4x zoom. The H70 model has 16mp and 10x zoom. I liked that I could continue using the same battery and use either the SD card or my memory stick pro duo cards.  However, there is no viewfinder, which made it very hard to take video because of the glare off the screen in bright sunlight. Also, the camera mode dial is on the top, which I find harder to use than my previous Sony. I am not a pro, just wanted a point and shoot. The battery discharges faster, perhaps because of the increased pixels? The video, although stated as 720p, does seem a bit better than the older camera which stated the vidio was 1080p. That was a pleasant surprise; it did help with shooting video of my grandids' sports events.I bought the bundle, it was a better deal. But the camera case is really tight; it does not hold an extra battery unless you jam one in. The case does not have a neck strap either.  All in all, it was the best price for this model camera that I've seen anywhere.

Reviews.Title: Totally disappointed with this camera
Reviews.Author: Dort Dolan
Reviews.Content: My good Canon Power Shot A2000is broke down after my daughter took it to the beach and sand got into it. I did some research looking for a replacement and finally decided to give Sony a try after doing some comparison shots in the Imaging-Resource web site. The shots taken by the Sony H70 fared really well compared to shots taken by the more expensive Canon Power Shot ELPH 500 HS. I went ahead and bought the Sony DSC-H70 with the blue finish. Right after the first picture taken with this camera I was concerned. Light management was terrible and the picture itself looked bad, not sharp at all. I took more than 300 pictures playing around with all the possible settings in different locations -all in daylight- and I have to tell you, I am so very disappointed with this camera. I am unforgiving with a camera that takes mediocre pictures. I am all for quality pictures. I have been a photographer for well over 40 years and I know a good picture. Call it trained eye or whatever. The best way to describe pictures taken by this camera is that they seem to be processed by a software that makes them look like a painting. I am sorry to say it, but I don't recommend this camera to anyone looking for great quality, sharp pictures. My old Canon A2000is and my current Canon A640 takes wonderfully sharp, natural pictures that put this Sony to shame. Today, I am returning the Sony H70 even though I'm going to lose around 30 dollars for the restocking fee gimmick of Frys Electronics. One last word, it seems to me that the Imaging Resource web site it is not a site to trust when deciding for a camera.

Reviews.Title: What else do you need?
Reviews.Author: Phillip J. Klein
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera because my wife didn't want to lug one of our Nikon SLR's around on our recent trip to Spain and South Africa.  It quickly became our go-to camera.After comparing the picture quality of photos taken with the Cyber-Shot to similar photos taken with a Nikon D70 (w/18-200 zoom lens), they are of near equal quality.  The metering on the Nikon is just slightly better, but with photoshop, that doesn't really matter.  Zoom is fantastic and compares to about a 150mm lens on a SLR.  The panorama feature is really neat and gives good quality coverage.  Having the built in movie feature is great.  Photos cannot begin to capture the essence of Zulu dancers.I'm willing to bet in the future that this camera gets used 5x more than our two Nikon SLR's.  I purchased the 16GB high speed memory card and didn't once have to worry about running out of storage.  Having a second battery came in handy.  Leaving the camera on means that the LCD viewing screen is on and that cuts into battery life. Order a spare battery with the camera (the newer model G battery provides remaining time estimate on the dispaly screen).

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H70
Reviews.Author: Larry
Reviews.Content: This is a great little Digital Camera! I purchased a Sony DSC-H70 for my Father-in-law for fathers day and liked it so well,I got one for myself. I couldn't believe how good the video recording is also. I have a Cannon Digital video camera and I believe the video is as good if not better than the Cannon! I have always used Kodak cameras and was skeptical of how the Sony picture would be. Not anymore this camera takes great still and video. I also got a great deal on extra batteries and a charger on Amazon. Got 2 extra batteries and a charger for less than $15 shipping and all! If you are looking for a point and shoot camera I think you will be very pleased with the Sony DSC-H70.

Reviews.Title: So happy with this camera!!
Reviews.Author: alwayssunny23
Reviews.Content: My first digital camera back in 2006 was a Sony Cybershot, and I absolutely loved it. I broke it last year during my senior year of college, and wound up getting persuaded by a salesperson to get an Olympus Stay Tough to prevent breaking another camera. I absolutely hated how it takes indoor pictures; all grainy and the shutter time is very slow. After doing a LOT of research, I finally decided to go back to Sony last week and purchased the H70. I have not seen a bad review on this camera anywhere. I tried it out over Father's Day Weekend and could not be happier with the crisp, clear pictures it produced. I got some awesome action shots both inside and out by the pool. I'm never leaving Sony again!!Pros:*Crisp, clear pictures*10 x zoom*Cropping feature in the camera. You can zoom in and crop a picture just how you want it.*Burst Mode- Allows you to hold down the shutter and it takes multiple pictures to get just the right action shot you want.*In low light setting, the camera automatically takes two versions of the picture with different lighting so that you get the best picture possible.*Great battery life.*Panoramic setting is great!*HD videos*Motion stabilizer feature*Scene selctions*Includes the wires necessary to show your pictures on a T.V.*Super user-friendly (even my grandmother uses a Sony because of how user-friendly it is)Cons:* A little bit bulkier than other Sony cybershots* Slight delay between taking pictures, could be faster

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Boogaloo
Reviews.Content: I have owned a Sony DSC-H1 for a long time and it has thrilled me for many years with outstanding 5mp photos through its Carl Zeiss lens.  Based on that experience, I had hoped it only got better with the DSC-H70 as a 'purse puppy' for my wife from a local vendor.  Alas, I'm in the 2-star camp on this one, especially against the price.  Compared to my quite dated 'H1', it has all gone backwards.One indoor flash and one lightly zoomed outdoor test shot in good light, both in auto mode, instantly sent me back to the returns department.  The indoor flash shot (actually several of one scene) never focused right.  An outdoor shot of our house in good light looked fine in a letter size print, but at 11x17 that 16mp should support, focus resolution and noise were just not acceptable. A point behind 16mp is preserving resolution in a crop .. unh, uh ... not with this camera.I'm wondering if the pixel wars have hit diminishing returns in small sensors.  Sometimes, less is more.  Rats. I did not bother to check any additional features; no point to it.

Reviews.Title: Great Sony Camera
Reviews.Author: Kimberly I. Lynch "Lynch Twins Mama"
Reviews.Content: Love my new sony.  Takes great pistures and video.  Easy to use and the soft skin feature is great for days when you are not looking your best.

Reviews.Title: LOVE LOVE LOVE!!!!!
Reviews.Author: oumom09
Reviews.Content: My husband bought me this camera for mother's day and it is absolute amazing! Even he really got into taking pictures with it because of it's good picture quality. It is worth the money and even better then some cameras over $200!! I have a 2-year-old who is always going, and it takes pictures of her going and going with no problems. Used it on an 18 hour road trip worked well driving, still, in the dark and in the day light. When the camera focus's on something it choose the right camera setting and takes a wonderful picture about 85% of the time there is still the 15% of the time when you might have to retake the picture.

Reviews.Title: Horrible photos in incandescent or bright lighting!
Reviews.Author: N. Porter
Reviews.Content: I had an old dinosaur of a Sony that took 1280 by 640 photos, max quality. It weighed a ton and was a solid 1/2 cubic foot block of dead weight (or so it seemed). So it was HIGH time to upgrade.  So seeing the wonderful reviews on this camera, and being happy with my previous one in spite of it being outdated, I happily ordered this one!Boy, what a PAIN this one was.  We have incandescent lighting and no matter how many "auto" settings I tried, I couldn't get the pictures to come out without them having a yellowish tint to them. On top of it, since we have a large family, the pictures were consistently ruined by one kid or another moving and making a big blurry area. It was terrible!  So I did research and changed some settings on the camera so that the shutter speed and other settings were better. I changed the White Balance to get rid of the yellow tinge (FINALLY!!).  Still, it was very much a pain to have to constantly reset the white balance before I took any pictures. Some of the pictures were still blurry, but it was ACCEPTABLE, barely.  Then I brought it to my new daughter's baptism and I got NOT ONE good picture because of the light coming through the windows. I am SO frustrated.  I would have used my DINOSAUR camera if I would have known that this brand new, almost $200 dollar camera COULD NOT TAKE BETTER PHOTOS!!!!  What good is a camera if you have to be messing around with settings before each one? Who has time to be messing with this before your child's special event, in the Church, etc???  I am FLABBERGASTED by all the 5 star reviews on this thing!So to continue the saga, I brought the camera to Best Buy to pick out a new one... and to see if I had a lemon.  Lo a behold the camera was acting fine THERE, under their fluorescent light... but was still a bit on the blurry side and the colors weren't quite right. Picked out a new Nikon Coolpix S9100 that took excellent pictures in the store, brought that home, and it's PERFECT. You point it at your kids, it takes a picture perfectly. You then point it out the window at the bright light and it adjusts and comes out perfect. Voila!  A camera that works!Oddly enough, I went to Sam's Club later that day after Best Buy and guess which camera I saw there? This Sony one!  And guess what it did as soon as I tested THAT one in the store? Yup, blurry picture and glare coming from the door of Sam's.  How in the WORLD did this camera get such good reviews??!!!  Needless to say I'm returning it even though I'm past the 30 day window and probably won't get my full refund back.  Adios, piece of junk! Pretty pitiful that you can't even take as solid pictures as a Sony from 10 years ago (that one takes 3.5" floppy disc too, just to show you how old it is! LOL)

Reviews.Title: 16.1 mega-poor quality
Reviews.Author: P. Dehne
Reviews.Content: The camera takes ok pictures when the conditions are optimal. Even when trying to adjust manually the settings, performance still suffers. The shutter is very slow, too slow for practical use. The LCD display is of poor quality. Feels cheaply made. Zoom noise is loud when shooting video. Video quality grainy.This camera would be a good starter camera for a 5 year old child.Sony really went cheap on the manufacturing of this camera. I thought I was buying a quality Sony product but ended up with a generic Sanyo instead.

Reviews.Title: Nice Compact Ultra-Zoom Point and Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: Robert W. Lade
Reviews.Content: The camera takes adequate-quality photos for this price range. The main feature is its ability to zoom 10x optically albeit at the cost of extra depth dimension. Still, it is a convenient, ready to go camera that suits my life-style very well. I was spoiled by the convenience of my old Sony H-1 ultra zoom because it was nice to use 2 AA batteries that are always available. This camera has Li Ion cells and the self discharge rate is pretty small, so it has been ready to go so far and I've not been stymied by wanting to get a shot and having to wait for a battery charge. For the money a good buy IMO.

Reviews.Title: Read this review - NOT a good camera
Reviews.Author: D. Miller
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a compact, simple to use digital camera that takes good photos, look elsewhere.  I'm pretty good with digital cameras and typically try most of the superfluous features on them - but this camera (Cyber-Shot DSC H70) just doesn't take good photos even with all of the fiddling with features.You will find this feedback point in other reviews, but whenever there is a white object in your photo - such as a white bowl in the center of the table or someone wearing a white shirt in a portrait photo - the white will be severely overexposed and will ruin the rest of the photo (even post-photo touching up doesn't work because the white-wash effect is so stark).  This is a major, major negative.  Honestly, indoors or outdoors, this effect occurs and it ruins pictures.Another aspect of this camera that ruins photos is that there are far too many options for simply taking a plain old portrait photo.  I needed to take a photo for a professional purpose.  I donned a suit and went to a building to have my photo taken with this camera (I'll admit upfront, I should have used something more professional).  We took 20 photos and the background was either far too dark, too yellow / orange, or completely grainy.  If a digital camera cannot take a straight-forward portrait of a person sitting down indoors (with or without flash), then it's worthless.  We had to go outdoors to take the photo, and then the white shirt caused a massive white-wash to occur in the photo which almost ruined it (I cropped the photo to a head shot which was usable).If you plan to use this camera for outdoor photos of landscapes when there is nothing too bright in the field of the photo, then this camera takes good photos.  The panorama function is good and works well.  These 2 points keep me from giving this product a 1-star rating.The auto smile detection, auto skin adaptation, and other bells and whistles are useless.  I want a camera that takes basic photos very well.  This is NOT that camera.I paid $189 (vs. $169).  It's not worth $169 either.  The zoom and hi pixel rating are attractive features, but the photos are grainy and cropping to a small portion of a hi-res photo doesn't look good.  I used to own Sony (T6) and had the memory card which I wanted to re-purpose.  This camera was not worth it.  I should have bucked up and gone with the T9 even though that camera has minimal zoom.

Reviews.Title: Has some bad features.....
Reviews.Author: Rita Mead
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera based on the reviews, without a demo. This was a BIG mistake.It has an exceptionally long "processing" time once you click the shutter of around 4 seconds, you don't see a freeze frame, but a black screen during that time. At the end of the 4 second delay, it FLASHES the image very quickly, in less than a second. If you want to see what you have, you have to mash buttons to go and look at it. I take images of art classes, so this is an AWFUL feature to me.The display is not as good as my old digital from 5 or 6 years back.One more issue: It has SOUND when any button is touched, like a cell phone may. However, in the camera, you don't seem to have a way to silence it. (So much for using it at a wedding or similar occasion!)The door at the bottom where you insert the card and battery is very weak, in the way it closes.Last straw was, the second week I had it, a piece of plastic showed up in the lens mechanism which was removed by the Best Buy service desk and called, "A piece of production material." ????? All in all, I think I could have done better for my $179.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: N. K. Peterson "Nostalgic-Buff"
Reviews.Content: [[ASIN:B004H8FNF8 Sony Cyber-Shot DSC-H70 16.1 MP Digital Still Camera with 10x Wide-Angle Optical Zoom G Lens and 3.0-inch LCD (Blue)In the 1980's I enjoyed photography as a hobby.  When my equipment wore out and my vision wasn't good any more I lost interest and gave it up.  About 12 years ago I received a hand me down digital camera from a family member who always has to have to best and latest of everything.  It was a nice little camera...simple to use; but with my poor vision it wasn't much fun; and I only used it on a rare occaision; but it wasn't for a hobby.Recently, I was looking for a new camera and, I compared several of the major brands that were priced under $200.00.  They sure have come a long way in technology.  I was able to narrow my search down to 3 camera's and spent much time weighing the pro's and con's of each. I carefully examined the cameras that were in the running for simplicity, quality, function, etc.  It was the large 3-inch screen that finally sold me on the DSC-H70; as well as, the extra features that allow just the right amount of creativity for me at this stage in life.WOW what a difference!  The Sony Cyber-Shot DSC-H70 is so easy to use.  You can actually see what you're taking a picture of and; I have not had any problem with glare or being unable to see what's in the screen when using it out-doors.  I'm still learning about all of the extra features; but it was so easy to set up, and I was able to try it out in no time.  The instructions could be a bit more thorough and perhaps include a comprehensive index.  But the on camera help is good for when you don't have your instruction booklet with you. It is a great camera for the price.  Plus their shade of Blue is my favorite color.Hooray! I don't have to squint or point and guess what's in the photos now.I do wish the camera came in a box-set with all of the accessorries.  If it does, I couldn't find it.The camera came with a corded strap, a transfer cable, a software disk, one battery and a battery charger.I was disapointed in the quality of the battery charger...flimsy plastic which looks and feels like it could easily break.  I can actually slightly squeeze the sides of the charger...it is not made of solid hard plastic like the ones I had seen before; and it does not have an charging adapter for travel use.  The charger did charge the battery without getting either hot.  Take note that it does not come with a memory card.  It does have enough internal memory for 3 photos.In conslusion, FOR THE PRICE IT'S A GREAT LITTLE CAMERA!  It's not just a point and shoot...it has some extra features that allow you to be creative. ie. self-portrait timer, manual operation mode , automatic mode option, plus many that I haven't played with yet.  The extended video option sounds like fun...I'm waiting for my memory card to arrive along with my hard shell camera case that has a memory foam lining so I can start enjoying my new Camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for your money
Reviews.Author: R. Ansley
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with this camera, I read reviews and compared cameras for a few days before settling on the DSC-H70.Takes great looking pictures and videos. The optical zoom is awesome, long range zoomed in shots look really good.It's easy to use and the auto picture setting is a good choice the majority of the time.The interface menus for fine tuning the picture type and other options are very smooth.The size of the camera is nice as well, fits easily into a pocket.I would recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: nice and compact...5 star
Reviews.Author: mike "jmb"
Reviews.Content: replaced a DSC-W350 which i really liked and had something spilled on it at a wedding...still trying to get it going. the H70 is not as small as the w350,but i like it better. there is a grip on right side that i really like. it is simple..easy..very easy to handle. the pictures have been great.the 10x zoom..probably not the best shot at full zoom, but not bad for a point and shoot. it is a very nice camera for the money. also amazon had a good price too. saw this at sams club for about $40 more plus tax. you will not be disappointed with this.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful, high end, crisp, bright, point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Shredder
Reviews.Content: I find the pictures of Sony most bright and colorful for point and shoot cameras. This is my second cyber shot purchase and this one has an outstanding zoom. As always, the images are crisp and rich in colors. Easy menu functions and fits nicely in hand. Better, it uses the the most common SDHC card, rather than memory stick which I think is an intelligent step from Sony.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: jaydee
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera right before a trip to Italy.  My Canon hadn't been operating properly and I needed another camera quickly.  This Sony cybershot dsc-h70 was such a great choice!  So easy to use the settings.  I could never really understand the Canon setting options or icons, no matter how many times I read the manual, but this camera was great.  Large print, easy explanations of each setting, large screen, really good zoom and fantastic pictures.  I'm a casual user, and look for ease of use and great pictures.  I would get this camera again and again, and would happily recommend it to anyone wanting a great little camera.

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected from price
Reviews.Author: Kat
Reviews.Content: Not what I was hoping to get from the money--what I'd expect from a $100 digital camera. The shutter speed was way too slow. The screen went black for at least 2-5 seconds between snapping a photo and actually capturing the picture. The focus wasn't even very impressive. Overall I was dissatisfied with the photo and screen quality. I've had an Olympus and Panasonic and liked them both much better than this (although both experienced lens errors, which I'm now paying to repair since this camera was a complete dissapointment.) I retuned this Sony camera the next day.

Reviews.Title: HHit and miss
Reviews.Author: T. A. Ernst
Reviews.Content: The pro side of this camera is close-up pictures.  It does an exellant job.  You can litterally be INCHES from the subject, where as my DSLR, even using the 50mm I must be around a foot away from subject.The downside, It does a horrible job focusing on distant subjects, as well as moving subjects.  I tried taking arial shots, and about 80% did NOT trun out.  Focus was either non existant, blurred, or fuzzy.  There was even major pixulation in some of the shots that were close to acceptable.Having an older sony when I started with digital cameras, their V1, I was VERY happy with the results it gave me.  This camera doesn't even come close.  Pictures taken with a phone camera resulted in beter results.If you just want a camera you can throw in your bag to use, it may do.  For any other type of shot, distance, or action, it falls short.

Reviews.Title: Love it! Does everything I wanted to do and more!
Reviews.Author: Denise Bell
Reviews.Content: I won't give you a 'highly detailed features' review. Their are better more concise writers out here who can. However, this camera the Sony DSC-H70, has given me some amazing shots. I am such an amateur. I got tired of family "smile and shoots" for my pictures. My old camera could do that very well. I wanted to take pics of the interesting and beautiful environment I suddenly found myself in, on California beaches. Between the Photos and the software that comes with the camera, I've come up with awesome pics. Pelicans in flight, Seals, Sea Lions and beautiful flowers. Take the pic, use the crop (to single out what you want to focus on) then use the color saturation to bring the color up and Voila! You have an awesome pic. Print it, frame it, share it, give it as a gift, great for bragging rights, awesome slide shows or make up cards or calendars, to share. Wish I could share with you the beautiful pictures I've been able to take. Thanks for listening. For the money, buy this camera! :D

Reviews.Title: Great for Scenery, Bad for Live Subjects
Reviews.Author: Antony Chow
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera mainly to replace a point and shoot camera that I somehow lost, and I tested this product out at the New York Comic Con 2011.  The convention is a perfect place to test the camera because the event has a lot of people (live subjects), products on display (still life), and big banners (scenery).  I use only the intelligent Auto setting for all my shots.The camera lens is fantastic.  The pictures that I took of banners 30-40 feet up in the air came out great.  The pictures that I took of figures and other merchandise inside display case are acceptable.  From past experience, I note that the glass and the lighting can be tricky, and distort the shots that I want to that.  But the H70 camera made auto adjustments with the flash, and the shots had minimal glare from the display windows.The camera is very user friendly.  I hate referring to instruction manuals, and the H70 has a button that pulls up the user guide, and allow you to search under terms for the topic you're looking for.My biggest problem, though, is that the camera is VERY SLOW in transferring pictures to the view screen.  Once I click on the button to take a shot, it took approximately three seconds for the picture to show up on the screen.  This is fine if you're taking scenery shots at a leisurely pace. It's horrible when you're taking shots of a cosplayer (a person in costume) who is posing specifically for you. I find myself able to take only two shots for a ten second pose.  I ended up taking shots, and praying that they came out right.  Something is wrong here when my cell phone camera can take photos faster than the DSC-H70 camera.Thus, this camera is a mixed bag for me.  And I doubt I will use it much, as I frequently take live shots with a point and shot camera.

Reviews.Title: This is amazing
Reviews.Author: Amir
Reviews.Content: It is an awesome camera. I mean, if you are not familiar with tuning the exposure or shutter speed, etc., the sense mode does exactly the duties of a professional photographer. Besides, the Li-ion battery as well as a charger lead you to get rid of those Alkaline batteries...! This Li-ion battery really works well. I charged it once and it has been almost a week that it is still working on that primary charge while I shot hundreds of photos...!

Reviews.Title: wonderful camera
Reviews.Author: Carlos A. Padilla
Reviews.Content: I love Sony cameras.  They are easy to handle, images are sharp and brigh and with this camera there are no bad pictures or cut faces.  I am enjoying my camera very much.  My only complain so far is that the battery doesn't seem to last very long before you need to recharge it.

Reviews.Title: It's a solid mid range camera, but not amazing.
Reviews.Author: Audio Guy in NC
Reviews.Content: The camera is built well, has a solid feel to it.  I use it as a point and shoot in 'Auto' mode since I just didn't want to mess with settings on each shot.  And so given that I use it in auto mode, I'm 'ok' with the results but not delighted.  What surprised me was that the still pictures were not as good in quality as with my very old DSC T9 6mp camera, also set for auto mode.  So I agree with many who have said its not really the mp number, but there are other factors.  Regarding the H70, I don't like the long lag when you turn the camera on or off----it takes too long for the lens mechanism to extend to to retract.  And the processing time is very long, so if you want to take action shots, be sure to use burst mode.  The image stabilization feature does work well with or without using the zoom, and the video shots do look good.  The look and feel of the camera are fine, you surely know the mechanical and case design are solid.  I've concluded that to get really good digital shots, you need to spend 400 or more dollars.  This is a good solid camera but it gives only slightly above average results in my opinion.  My old DSC T9 does a better job for me, which as I mentioned, was a surprise, but it is what it is!  I will keep the H70, but it is not what I had hoped for.  I'm not a professional photographer.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Lanigan
Reviews.Content: I have only had this camera for a week and already love it!! I have been taking pictures for years, my first camera was the disc. If that doesn't age me I don't know what does.  I have had many cameras through the years and this is by far the best yet.  It is so easy to use, takes great shots and the video is amazing. Took my 2 year old to the beach and couln't stop snapping the pics! Couldn't wait to go home, load them on the laptop and print them out!! The quality of these photos are crystal clear and picture perfect.  I would highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Love the Soft Skin feature
Reviews.Author: Daniel Cooper "K Cooper"
Reviews.Content: This is my 6th Sony camera. It's very simple to use, and takes fantastic shots.  The Soft Skin feature is amazing.  Takes ten years off your face if you are of a certain age, and removes zits if you are of another.  It's hard to take a bad picture with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Vague and Unclear features
Reviews.Author: tominoakland
Reviews.Content: This is my third digital camera going back to 2001. I have only had my DSC H70 about 3 weeks and I will eventually get used to it, I'm sure. The camera feels nice and has most controls at user-friendly locations, and takes good pictures at basic auto settings. The biggest problem is that it has a minimally helpful owner's manual, little more than a Quick-Start guide, and then a myriad amount of on-screen potential directions which lack focus or explanations. My last digital was a 2006 Kodak 6 Megapixel that had less features or power but was infinitely better explained. The menu, preferences and settings have a ton of jargon without any explanation of what the feature is or does, or why you might want to use it. Some of the features are just meaningless abbreviations. I guess one could Google each term and maybe figure out what it was, but what would have been so hard to provide explanations as you explore the camera's features. Weird little icons sometimes appear on the screen about which I haven't a clue what they stand for. An icon/on-screen symbol glossary would be a lot of help. I have had several Sony TVs in the past and I thought they were the best. I have no idea what they think they were doing here, but it ain't good.

Reviews.Title: Fish eye effect and images are not real
Reviews.Author: janakiramu.lammatha
Reviews.Content: Horrible fisheye effect.We can't use for closeups.Images not look real.Sony xpearia (8mp camera) takes better pictures than this.10X zoom is a joke.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy !
Reviews.Author: Sandy "Sandy"
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with my new Camera so far still learning some functions..i had a Sony camera previously for 15 yrs so decided after reading reviews to purchase the Cybershot..it is easy to use and could not beat the price i got it for on Amazon..hope to have many years with this camera also..The camera came quickly and exactly as was described..

Reviews.Title: very good  camera
Reviews.Author: Willie L. Sweat
Reviews.Content: We have a dsl camera but wanted a small pocket size camera.  Did a lot of research and we bought the sony H70.  Have had it nearly 3 months and it has met our dsesires and needs.  The size of this camera, the zoom and picture quality are really good.  I would recomend this camera to anyone needing this type of camera.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber-Shot DSC-H70 16.1 MP
Reviews.Author: Yooper Red Hatter
Reviews.Content: HUGE improvement from my 6 yr. old Olympus 5.1 MP! Love the lighter, more compact & big screen features!I did have to charge it every night on a recent trip. Ran out of battery life after less then 100 pictures. I willpurchase another battery & always be ready when I know I'll be taking many pictures. I am not sorry I bought this camera!

Reviews.Title: High Quality pictures!
Reviews.Author: Andreina A. Monsalve S
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I've been traveling a lot this year and a I realized that I was needing a camera that gave me the opportunity to take pictures with low or no light and that's what I like about this camera because it takes very nice pictures no matters the light of the place. The only thing is that the camera it's kind of slow in comparison with others cyber shots but for me pictures quality is more important than that.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera!
Reviews.Author: Elisabeth B. Beeman
Reviews.Content: This is an easy to use 'point and shoot' and more camera. On screen info, directions and ease of making movies make this a great choice for novices or advanced users. The zoom controls are easy to use and the 16.1 MP make for shots that are nice and clear for great after shot enlargements.Only disappointment was that the photo clearly shows the camera as a BLUE color. Actual camera looks black-blue.

Reviews.Title: It is a great pocket camera.
Reviews.Author: Nannette Wilson
Reviews.Content: I like having a camera in my purse or pocket at all times.  The menu is easy to navigate if you need to make changes in exposure, WB, ISO. The images seem clear.  I have not had time to work with HD video recording or the Panoramic Stitch.

Reviews.Title: awesome camera
Reviews.Author: L. West
Reviews.Content: I love it!  This is so much better than anything I've ever had before.  Can't wait to take it to a wedding in a few weeks to see how it preforms there.  However, the ONLY drawback I have with it is the battery...it needs to be recharged in a charger.  I prefer the ones I can just pop in and out batteries when I need to esp when on vacation.

Reviews.Title: Sony H70
Reviews.Author: Captric
Reviews.Content: I am a Real Estate Agent and this camera takes amazing pictures. I also purchased a wide angle lens and use it to do video tours of my listings! A very good buy.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Nicolas Parra "Nikko"
Reviews.Content: This is a Excellent Camera with a huge lens, that lets you take awesome photos and very affordable. 5 Stars!.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: L. Newport
Reviews.Content: For an easy point and shoot camera....this one can do it all. Even has a landscape feature for capturing wider images. Great bundle for the price.

Reviews.Title: Perfect camera !
Reviews.Author: Umar
Reviews.Content: I just got my Sony today and i really liked it. The perfect quality,compacted size and design was all that i wanted to buy for this price. Working fast and a lot of good characteristics which makes happy.

Reviews.Title: Worth the Money
Reviews.Author: Sabindra Pradhan
Reviews.Content: Decent camera for the price. 16mp and 10x zoom is the best I can count on. The camera itself is bit heavier and bulky. I use Auto mode most of the time which is great feature for novice users. The bad part that I am not happy about is, it takes bit longer to process between taking pictures. E.g U click one pic then it takes few seconds to refresh to be ready for another pic. So some real natural moments could be missed like blowing off birthday candles etc. It seems like it works slow at night/dark. Daytime it take great pictures and comes alive but as it gets darker it kinda slows down!!

Reviews.Title: Great pictures, tough placement of dials etc.
Reviews.Author: K. Grimes "bigredken"
Reviews.Content: This is our second Sony point-and-shoot camera (we broke the screen on the first one) and we love the pictures, panorama capability, and HD video.  The wide-angle and big zoom are nice as well!  The only reason this one did not get 5 stars is that the selection dial for type of shot is placed awkwardly beside the shutter button.  Your finger can often inadvertently rotate that dial when moving to take a picture...just need to pay careful attention to not lay your finger across that dial.  Otherwise a good value!

Reviews.Title: Reunited <3
Reviews.Author: Jordan Ashleigh Diehm
Reviews.Content: I had bought this camera Black Friday of 2011, and i absolutely loved it. When it broke i was devastated. I bought other cameras but i just wasn't impressed. When i saw this on amazon for the awesome price, i couldn't pass it up. I'm just as in love as i was before. It's perfect <3

Reviews.Title: Horrible Camera
Reviews.Author: Ms. Mota "Reading Teacher"
Reviews.Content: This camera is pretty horrible. I had to replace my other Sony Cybershot that was touch screen. I must be doing something wrong because it does not take motion shots very well. Trying to implement the FLASH is very complicated. Color and pictures are distorted.  After you take the picture, whoever is being photographed has to remain still while the camera processes the picture. This takes a least 5 seconds. If the person moves, then the pictures comes out blurry. I am very disappointed in this camera.

Reviews.Title: DIDN'T GET TOO MANY USES OUT OF IT...
Reviews.Author: Sunshine
Reviews.Content: This was a birthday gift for my 13 year and after taking a looking at the cam and playing around with it I was so impressed I want to buy for myself!!! I love it and so did my daughter! Takes beautiful keen shots and they look professional. Awesomeness!!!! - However, I we didn't get too many uses out of it after two weeks, the camera ended up defected because the shutter did not close when being shut off and there is a buzzing sound like trying to do its thing and shut off. I have done the troubleshooting on it per Sony's website and reset it but didn't do anything for it. I'm bummed out! I would suggest that if you are making this type of purchase online let it be a new product, and not used as it were probably just adjusted and resold to get rid of fast!

Reviews.Title: Not happy at all with this camera!
Reviews.Author: S. Lennox
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for nearly a year now and am not happy at all.  When I purchased it I went on the reviews, back then, they were all basically good.  If I knew what I know now, I would never have purchased this camera. I can take 4 pictures on auto setting in a row and only 1 will come out decent. How can that even happen? Nothing changed? The shutter speed is horrible. There is a long lag time between shots. Gee maybe that is why they come out blurry, natural lighting has changed in the minutes it has taken to take the 4 pictures! I have pets, I cannot take pictures of them even with the Pet setting.  I love to take pictures of fireworks, you can forget that with this camera.  If you do not have the perfect lighting, you will not get a decent picture. There are times that it takes a while for the lens to even come out when I go into zoom mode, almost as if the camera isn't recognizing it what it has to do.  I have never experienced this with any other camera I have owned, and I have owned many in my (many) years of taking pictures (how many can say they remember the brownie camera lol).I cannot recommend this camera to anyone but a child learning to shoot . It's not worth the money. It has gone down in price drastically since I purchased and I can see why.  This is a disgrace to the Sony name!  Sony has much cheaper camera's that take better pictures than this one.  My daughter will be getting married in May. I am currently looking for a camera that I know I can rely on, not one that takes 1 out of 4 pictures that come out clear.

Reviews.Title: Awsome camera!
Reviews.Author: Emiliano
Reviews.Content: This camera was just awsome. I LOVE the panoramic function it has. Its takes very nice panoramic pictures and 99% of them came out with no overlapping or shadows. Dont know how they do it but they certainly did it well on this one.Pictures quality was very good. I actually have a Cannon DLSR and pictures were "comparable" to human eye if you just expected them to be use for normal picture frame (no design or photograpy quality). Advance or manual mode on it had what I needed for certain situations.The auto scene mode seems to work very well also since all my pictures came up perfect.I seemed to find it balanced in terms of picture quality, ease of use and appealing to advance users.For this price, It is a great buy.

Reviews.Title: All start point and shoot - grab one while you can!!
Reviews.Author: Avner Streich
Reviews.Content: I"m sorry that I don't have more energy to write a better review, however if you are looking for a great point and shoot that won't break the budget please get the H70 while they are still around.  If not, it's replacement the H90 would be a fine substitute.  The DSC-H70 is actually a 2011 model that is still being sold (NEW) by Amazon and their partners that still have them in stock.  While this was a $229 - $249 camera last year (the current price of the H90),  I snagged it for just shy of $175.  You can buy it from one of Amazon's partner stores so long as it is new in box.  I was also able to add the Square Trade warranty to my camera with damage protection at a very reasonable price (about $40).  The H70 does not have a very powerful zoom but when it is engaged the pictures are still very accurate.  Leaving the flash in Auto mode (called Intelligent Auto) seems to allow for the capture of just the right amount of light .  I have not tried this cam in a room that is completely dark yet.There are a lot of technology critics who will say the best point and shoot is on the iPhone 4s, but some of you are probably like me and do not want to have to pay $100 a month just to use a camera.  Don't kid yourself this camera is not a DSLR or the higher end Canon S95.  However, I am VERY satisfied with this model and would recommend the H70/H90 to anyone.  Picture stability / auto focus is amazing.

Reviews.Title: A good pocket camera
Reviews.Author: vashistha
Reviews.Content: H70 is really good camera, read the good and bad things aboutGood:1. Slim and compact, easily goes on pocket2. 16Mp and 10X zoom in a compact body3. Excellent portrait mode of soft and smooth skin.Bad:1. Noise at low light shooting (even at base ISO), you need a good noise remover software2. Short battery life

Reviews.Title: SONY DSC-H70
Reviews.Author: N. Andrews
Reviews.Content: Camera works fine.  Videos are great.  There is some barrel distortion on the periphery  for relatively close interior pictures, but I can live with that.

Reviews.Title: It's just OK
Reviews.Author: istkrieg
Reviews.Content: Just like the title of my review says, this camera is just OK. If you are looking for an OK camera to give to your kid as a gift or this is going to be your first ever camera purchase and you want something simple and relatively inexpensive, then this one will do. Otherwise, look elsewhere. We were looking to upgrade from our 6 or 7-year old Sony and this camera turned out to be not an upgrade at all. Other than a bigger screen and a better zoom, this camera brings absolutely nothing else to the table. We weren't impressed with the colors, we weren't impressed with the quality of photos taken in the low light and we occasionally noticed that 'fish-eye' effect that other reviewers have mentioned. All in all, you get what you pay for. We are now considering going up a couple of steps on the price ladder to buy a camera that will finally be considerably better than our old Sony.

Reviews.Title: Rock Solid Camera
Reviews.Author: Leonard Wiley
Reviews.Content: We had a Cyber-Shot before this model and were pleased with the years of good photos. This one is even better. It has a better lens and does things like taking 2 shots when the light is low. Make sure you get a big enough memory stick!Another thing we like about the Sony is that even though it comes with software, it's not needed. XP will see it as a memory device so you can pull the images in directly.

Reviews.Title: I loved the HD pics..
Reviews.Author: rajprince88
Reviews.Content: I loved the picture quality and the video quality. Though the video is not full HD, it is as good as other 1080p HD cameras.

Reviews.Title: Can't go wrong with a Cyber-Shot
Reviews.Author: W.Shop.0126
Reviews.Content: I had a Cyber-Shot before purchasing this one (wanted to up my mp) and I am SO happy I chose this model. It is easy to use, I didn't have to read the manual, just played with it for a while. Very comprehensive for the 'not so techno saavy' person. A lot of settings for different scenarios make for an easy go-to camera, and with its smaller size, it fits right in my pocket or purse. Great zoom, video quality is nice, and is lightweight. I take a LOT of photos, both for myself and for other people, and this camera is perfect for what I needed. I love Sony products!

Reviews.Title: cool little camera
Reviews.Author: Melanie
Reviews.Content: love the soft focus feature, it makes beautiful portraits.  It is easy to use and takes lovely photos.  Im very happy with it!

Reviews.Title: great but not the best!
Reviews.Author: Tara Balwant
Reviews.Content: I decided to upgrade my sony cybershot to this 110x optical zoom...it isn't a noticeable upgrade,except you can zoom more,the quality of the pics is more or less the same as my last camera...but it does take great shots,sometimes it takes some time for the snapshot to be taken as it's a bit delayed and when I load my pics on my computer from my camera,somehow the videos don't transfer,and I don't know why and how to fix this problem which I didn't have with my last cam. The camera's lid which you have to slide to get the battery has become a bit loose,i don't know why,cos my camera is brand new and has never fallen,it's pretty annoying,i hope it doesn't get worse as i paid about almost 200 US for my camera....apart from these drawbacks,it's a good cam to buy...

Reviews.Title: Amazing Photos!
Reviews.Author: Amber "amberhaven2001"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as an early Christmas gift for myself and I am SO glad I did. It is very easy to use even without looking at the instructions that come with it. I used it today to take outdoor concert photos and they turned out beautifully. I searched for over a year to find a new camera that I liked, had the features I was looking for, and had a decent price. I love the Intelligent Auto Mode, it takes the guesswork out of which mode to use for photos, it automatically senses what you are taking a photo of and adjusts for it. Wonderful, wonderful camera and I am so glad I made this purchase.

Reviews.Title: This camera y perfect between price and quality
Reviews.Author: Jose Miguel
Reviews.Content: The Sony Cyber shot take a perfect picture. The time to arrive was in the time according. I am happy with this product and recommend 100%.

Reviews.Title: Wide Angle Distortion
Reviews.Author: Dancing & Racing
Reviews.Content: Certainly a full featured, easy to use camera. I bought it for the larger lens, hoping for improved quality. Shooting medium to distant is good, anything close up gets a fisheye distortion. I'm really very disappointed with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Good and small
Reviews.Author: María
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!! I was looking for a small camera but with a good optical zoom. This one is perfect, because it is easy to carry and you can get really good pictures with it.The only issue is the fact that when you take a picture, it takes a few seconds to be ready for the next picture. It is kind of slow even when you wanna check the picture you took, so you have to be patient.But, for that, you need to see what do you want the camera for? For me, it is good.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: snc
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I was looking for an easy but high-quality camera with more of a zoom than my old one. I couldn't be more happy with my choice. It's small and fits in my pocket or purse, it has tons of features I love - including the panoramic shot, dual picture setting and multiple face finder - and I haven't taken a single shot with red-eye. I never worry when I ask someone to take a picture with this camera, because I know it will turn out great. It has way more features than I need, but at this price, it's not like I overpaid for them. Maybe I'll read the manual one day and figure out how to use them!

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Emilysabeth
Reviews.Content: It's a great product, it takes very amazing pictures, I love it, is very comfortable and light weight, I recommend it a lot

Reviews.Title: works good for the price
Reviews.Author: Margaret J. Lynne
Reviews.Content: beautiful camera and the picture quality is excellent for electronic type of transmissions.  not sure I would use it for very large high quality color prints due to a little distortion but I almost never do this.  for computer screen and tv screen presentation, it is very good quality.  the wide scene stitching is a great new feature that adds unique shots to your albums etc.  I buy a new sony every year in this price range to get the new features and I have been very happy with them.  Sony is reducing the settings options on this and other similar cameras in the last couple years but I don't really miss them since I have rarely beat the auto settings in my shooting.

Reviews.Title: the best camera
Reviews.Author: D. Patel
Reviews.Content: if u are looking to buy easy to use operation and nice camera this is the best choice, just put it in intelligent mode , and it will do everything for u ,i bought nikon camera before almost more than double prize and more features , but this camera is very good at this price , even more than 300 dollars camera won't work like this, it don't matter what kind of whether, light, or dark , it will adjust everything for u ,i m not a person like to write review, but using this camera u will write one review toothis is a great buy, after all its sony

Reviews.Title: A really good one
Reviews.Author: ale7714
Reviews.Content: Got this month for my mom, and she love it, she's no a pro of anything but she feels this cam do a great job and is easy to use. Recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful!
Reviews.Author: hanniebananie
Reviews.Content: This camera exceeded all expectations I had. The photo quality is fantastic and I couldn't ask for better quality photos. The zoom is great. The only thing that could be improved is the battery life. Overall love this camera!

Reviews.Title: Good camera ,would expect better results for the pictures taken in dark
Reviews.Author: Shinai
Reviews.Content: Nice camera , good specifications and options available. The picture quality is good. Day time pictures are good, but pictures taken in the dark, with conditions in where there is not so bright ....the night mode settings still dont work really excellent. sometimes when you zoom up to the optimum the picture looks little darker and not as bright as it would look when taken with normal or less zoom. Overall its good for normal regular snaps. Videos clarity is good in daytime...again could have been better for videos which are taken in absence of the daylight.. Nice camera , was well packed and received in good condition

Reviews.Title: William
Reviews.Author: William Gore
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with the camera and the service of Amazon. The camera is outstanding, easy to use and great pictures for someone who is not into picture taking for a career. I have had many cameras in the past but enjoy taking this with me when I travel.

Reviews.Title: great customer service
Reviews.Author: petstairz
Reviews.Content: The camera takes wonderful pictures and videos and is fairly easy to use. the cusotmer service was wonderful. I actually got to speak to a live person and he was very good with shipping the camera immediately and he followed up! good customer service is rare these days.

Reviews.Title: This is an OK Camera, but not great
Reviews.Author: ltaylor
Reviews.Content: This is an ok camera for the price, but you could probably do better.  You get a lot of megapixels and zoom for the price, but I don't think the camera is great at auto focus.  I used to have an Olympus that cost about the same amount but had much better focus, especially for macro photos.  I have been disappointed in the macro setting on the Sony.  I think my wife's Iphone takes better point and shoot photos, which is disappointing since I am always saying I'll use my camera to take pictures and my phone to call people.  But now I'm starting to eat my words because honestly about a third of the photos I take with the camera are out of focus.

Reviews.Title: Love Sony products but this camera not so much!
Reviews.Author: shareshoe
Reviews.Content: I have always owned Sony cameras and thought that this camera was a perfect match for me. Not a lot of settings, just want to take good pictures of my kids and grandkids. Needed a good zoom for taking pictures of the kids sports and vacations, and that is where this camera disappoints. The still shots are great with auto setting, but the zoom blurs the shot no matter how close or far the subject. It says 10X zoom, but don't count on it. You can zoom in but you won't be able to tell what you shot.

Reviews.Title: sony cybershot H70
Reviews.Author: LaBibliotecaria
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a few days ago from Staples.  I haven't had much time to play with it. Only took a few  trial pictures and they turned out  good for the lighting. The only downfall initially is that although it takes the picture quick it has to think a few seconds before it gives you the picture.  This is as far as I have gotten EXCEPT for the SD card.Something that isn't being said  in the reviews for this camera  and can become an headache if  you are not aware of it is the memory car. You cannot buy any card for this. It takes a sony  card. No other card will work.  I bought a 4g  all purpose card. SDHC and the camera kept telling me to reinsert the card. I called the store up to find out about it and the guy told me Sony takes only Sony.Well, needless to say this presents a major problem because I have 2 other cards which are 2g and they are kodak.  They do not work in this camera as well SO if I  wished to download some of those pictures I cannot do it.What does this mean for me in the end? It means researching another camera and  finding one that will be compatiblie with my kodak branded memory cards as well as any other card for that matter.It really is a shame because from what little I did see of this camera it looked very promising.  I think if it weren't for the memory card situation it would be a keeper for me BUT that becomes a huge stumbling block. BUYER BEWARE!Oh, I gave it 3 stars because I only used it a little bit and it seemed promising but with a major issue such as the memory card I figured this deserves some serious attention and it may end up costing some people unneeded headaches for the future.  So I decided to drop it 2 stars.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: William Carson
Reviews.Content: I picked up this camera a few days before a trip down south for my brother graduation. Based on reviews from other tech websites it seemed like a good deal compared to other products in it's price range. The camera is a good size, can fit in your pocket or backpack without problems; in addition it takes good quality photos, just as good or better than other point-and-shoot digital cameras I have used. This camera also has a good video option which allows you to record in high def, and I was very impressed with the results; I was able to clearly zoom in on a subjects in a graduation ceremony despite sitting several rows up in a big arena. Obviously if you are expecting photos that come from cameras that cost several hundred to thousands of dollars you will be disappointed; but this camera provides everything that a casual picture taker would want. The panorama feature is also very cool, even though it can take a try or two to get a hold of.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!!!
Reviews.Author: DynahMom:) "DynahMom:)"
Reviews.Content: I like this version so much better than the newer one - My mom had this one and I loved hers, but could only find the newer version in stores. :(  So glad I found this older version here on amazon - Have never had a better camera!

Reviews.Title: Sony is the best
Reviews.Author: Juan A.
Reviews.Content: Great gift for my sister...i hope she is using it every day.....this camera started me in the photo world, i can't stop taking pictureas now thanks to it.....

Reviews.Title: Fantastic travel companion
Reviews.Author: Lori Slentz
Reviews.Content: I love this camera so much I hardly use my older models.  Only complaint is no View finder.  Photos are more difficult to view in bright sunlight.  However, shots still look great and have an exceptional quality in color and clarity.

Reviews.Title: I bought it one year ago and it displays an Error !!!
Reviews.Author: P&G; A. Cecilia Argueta
Reviews.Content: I took it to  a Sony Center and they said the internal memory has a problem that I have to change it, and the memory is more expensive than teh camera !!!!!

Reviews.Title: Didn't last
Reviews.Author: mudpie
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in October 2011.  It comes with a one year warranty.  After 1 year and 10 months, the camera stopped working.  I called Sony, who told me that I could send it in to them and they will repair it for a flat fee of $107.  Completely unacceptable!!  I purchased a Sony thinking I would get a product that would last.  I will never buy a Sony again!

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: William Yunda
Reviews.Content: Very fast shoot and it takes good photos.Very good zoom, I am happhy with my new camera.Sony is good

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Morrell Townsen
Reviews.Content: One of the best small cameras out. It works great for recording videos. And it take crisp clear photos in the light and in low light settings. That is why I bought it.

Reviews.Title: Great Seller
